Job Title: Assistant Controller

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Assistant Controller Join the dream team of 80/20 experts on a mission to guide the world’s top manufacturing leaders to explosive results.
Who are we?
Strategex is the premier 80/20 Profit & Growth consulting firm. We guide our manufacturing clients to 25X ROI. We have a 30-year track record of success, and we are united in the mission of “Helping People Win.”
Who are you?
· You are a CPA with a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting.· You have 3+ years of accounting and finance experience, with a focus on financial reporting, financial planning and analysis, and financial modeling, along with 1+ years of experience in tax reporting.· You possess a strong understanding of US GAAP and financial reporting standards.· You have experience working with various accounting and ERP systems.· You have excellent analytical, reasoning, and problem-solving skills.· You are passionate about Strategex’s mission of “Helping People Win” and embody our Strategex Fundamentals.
What will you do?
You will play a pivotal role in the financial management of the company, supporting the CFO in all aspects of our accounting and finance operations. This includes preparing accurate and timely periodic financial statements, conducting insightful financial analyses, and creating financial modeling tools that provide robust scenario planning.
More specifically, you will:
Prepare and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements, including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements.Ensure compliance with accounting standards, regulatory requirements, and company policies.Present accurate and timely financial and management reports to the company’s leadership.Conduct variance analysis and provide explanations for financial discrepancies.Prepare comprehensive financial strategic plans, budgets, and forecasts based on the company’s strategic goals.Manage the company's budgeting process, working closely with department heads to establish budgets and monitor spending.Track budget variances and implement corrective actions as needed to ensure financial targets are met.Calculate, track, and report key performance indicators in ways that are visually appealing and easy to understand.Provide financial modeling and analysis to support decision-making, in particular, pricing decisions, contract negotiations, and strategic investments.Collaborate with external tax advisors to assist in preparing federal, state, and local tax returns to ensure compliance with tax regulations and deadlines.Identify opportunities for automation and implement new tools or systems as needed. Why will you thrive?
You will become part of a close-knit culture that is grounded in its 25 Fundamentals, promotes work/life balance with a remote working environment, and is filled with opportunities for engagement, learning, and fun.
You will never stop learning. Strategex is committed to employee professional development by investing in employee Master’s programs, structured employee continuing education, and structured internal training.
You will receive a generous compensation package that includes a competitive base salary, a generous discretionary bonus based on performance, a company-paid 4% 401(k) contribution, competitive health benefits, and generous paid time off.
Interested?
If you are a motivated and detail-oriented professional with a passion for accounting, we would love to hear from you.Please send your resume to Sandy Nash at opportunities@strategex.com to connect and learn more about our dynamic and growing organization. 
Strategex is an equal-opportunity employer that complies with EEOC rules and regulations. Hiring decisions are based exclusively on merit, qualifications, and business needs.

Experience Level (if available): None
